medical_history.chief_complaint: Pain and swelling of the right hand and hypotension.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was well until 2 days prior, when he noticed a lesion on the dorsum of his right hand thought to be an insect bite. The following day, the hand became swollen and painful, and he felt ill, experiencing chills and a temperature of 38.6Â°C. He became obtunded and vomited before emergency medical services transported him to a hospital.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Seasonal allergies; previous myringotomies, inguinal herniorrhaphy, and wisdom teeth extraction; allergy to sulfamethoxazole.
medical_history.family_history: Parents are well; family members have diabetes, hypertension, and thyroid disease.
medical_history.social_history: Lives on a farm, works in construction, exposed to animals (horses, dogs, cats). Smokes cigarettes, drinks alcohol socially, and does not use intravenous drugs. Recent abscesses treated with warm compresses, recent course of prednisone for a cough.
